subject: VAM Pro Linear
description_text:
Hello, I recently bought a VAM Pro Linear Motor, but I'm having a problem
with them. Any vibration activates the brake sensor, so even when I'm
driving straight, the vibrations from the gas pedal activate the brake (in
response to the vibrations). The same thing happens with the brake pedal.
Any vibration adds input to the brake, rendering the entire setup
unusable.Is there any way to compensate for this?

conversations.body_text: Hi Sebastian Baran,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding     https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1n291hi/solution_for_simsonn_vam_pro_emi_issues/

That's not solutions to my problem. O David that any vibration triggers
brake sensor. I didn't mention anything about disconnecting or something.
Please read again my request

śr., 26 lis 2025, 11:38 użytkownik service@simsonn.com
Hi Sebastian Baran,    You can try installing the VAM Pro motors using nylon screws and nylon washers to see if it improves the issue.
